name: You can do it when you Astro-turf it!
description: Raising funds for a Multi-Sports Facility for more activities & opportunities for the children at St Mary's RC Primary School.

name: Cambridge Sustainable Food Hub
description: We invite you to join us in creating what we believe to be the most ambitious and exciting sustainable food project at the moment, not only in Cambridge, but in the whole UK. The Sustainable Food Hub.

name: Hub A: Hull's Creative Community Space
description: Help a community-driven, nonprofit arts hub for the creative community of Hull to grow!

name: Poplar Scoot!
description: The school is creating a unique Scooter Park in which young children can ride and play on their scooters in a safe and attractive environment - both in the school day and also at the weekends.

name: Lewisham Youth Conference 2017
description: LYC 2017 aims to provide young people with an empowering and inspiring environment offering a wealth of knowledge in the form of information stands, educational workshops and entertainment.

name: Where the arts meet
description: In 2023 the Scottish Arts Club will celebrate its 150th anniversary. This project aims to ensure that by that date, the Club can look back with pride and look forward to the future with confidence.

name: Sown in Bolton
description: We're tackling food poverty in Bolton directly by giving people living on housing estates the resources and support to grow their own food. With your help we want to work with 100 families this year.

name: Extra swings for Clissold Park
description: We plan to install three new swings for babies and toddlers in our playground so kids can spend less time queuing and more time swinging.

name: Hello Hoxton High Street
description: PEER makes the experience of great art part of daily life. We want to maximise our visibility from the street, to entice and welcome audiences to enjoy our exhibitions and participation programmes.

name: Buy our Legion
description: We want to buy the British Legion building to become a community hub with café/bar, venue space and other facilities the village wants. Pledge today and if we aren’t successful no money will be taken.

name: A New Creative Hub for Wood Street
description: We want to unleash creativity in our streets & spaces. By building an artistic space for our community, we will bring more fun and excitement to Walthamstow for all to enjoy!

name: Fibre for the Truman
description: Installing fibre broadband in the Truman,Hop House,Maltings Park and Heathlands primary school.

name: Eat, drink, learn and play
description: Our community Coop will run a cafe, social, cultural and educational training space in a Tottenham Park encouraging increased park usage and enjoyment, volunteering, healthy eating and general fun

name: Restoration and Gateway to Sailing
description: We are looking for financial help towards the restoration of a 1936 50ft wooden sailing yacht, in return we will introduce 250 local children to classic sailing on-board the fully restored vessel.

name: Penge Heritage Trail
description: Celebrating the rich and fascinating heritage and history of Penge for local residents and visitors.

name: DOG KENNEL HILL PLAYGROUND NEW BUILDING
description: Help us build a fantastic new building for our Adventure Playground. Your pledges will enable us to complete the planning process. Permission depending, we'll then run another campaign for the build!

name: South Norwood Lake Playground
description: We want to update, regenerate and vastly improve the much-loved but tired children's playground at South Norwood Lake and Grounds

name: Light Up Acomb This Christmas
description: We want to bring some Festive Christmas Cheer to Acomb this Christmas, with the installation of Festoon style lighting in the main shopping areas. Please support us!!

name: The Eel Pie Island Museum
description: We are sitting on a wealth of fantastic musical history with a ready market of people wanting to see it. It's time to give people a reason other than rugby to come to Twickenham!

name: The Flyover Liverpool
description: We want to turn a concrete flyover into an amazing urban park for Liverpool - a vibrant place full of life, trees, shops, exhibitions & joy. Help us bring our vision to life!

name: Shuffle Reinvents The Lodge
description: The team from Shuffle Festival aims to bring to life the historic lodge in Tower Hamlets Cemetery Park (THCP) and build an exciting new heart for Mile End.

name: Well Street Market
description: Well Street Market will be an innovative model of a community market, locals will access healthy, affordable, good quality food along with a Teenage Market, Student Makers Market and live music stage.

name: Weavers Kids Cafe and Community Pizzeria
description: Our not-for-profit cafe will teach kids to cook and sell affordable healthier meals, with costs funded by our Community Pizzeria, which will also help sustain Weavers Adventure Playground.

name: The Line: a sculpture walk for London
description: The Line will be a world-class sculpture walk in London. The route broadly follows the line of the Meridian, linking two of the iconic sites of East London: Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and the O2.

name: Partisan Collective - DIY Space
description: Creating a space for independent, DIY, cultural and political activities in Manchester. Partisan is a co-operative, democratically owned and managed by the people who work in and use the space.

name: York Arts Barge
description: Help us turn a barge into a unique arts and performance venue for York: a place for you and yours to enjoy music, art, dance and theatre or just a local ale or a cuppa and cake with us on the river!

name: Keep the Puppet Barge up and floating!
description: You will help us to keep the barge and the puppets afloat! We will be able to continue presenting shows for children and adults in the London canal and River Thames.

name: Real Change- Night Shelter & Shower Room
description: The ‘Real Change’ campaign is raising funds for charities (Night Light Winter Shelter and Shower Room) who provide help and support to those people sleeping on the streets in Basingstoke and Deane.

name: Wanstead Playground Phase 1
description: We did it! Thank you all for your amazing support, and we're delighted to announce the second phase of our renovation will be launching shortly. Updates at @wansteadplay & wansteadplayground.co.uk

name: The Phoenix Garden Blooms
description: The Garden is about to reopen after the construction of our new community building. We want to re-landscape and refurbish the garden for our new visitors!

name: Kitchenette Karts
description: A healthy, sustainable fish & chips truck in the heart of the East End, creating pathways into entrepreneurship for young East Londoners. Established by the award-winning Kitchenette.

name: The Renovation of Wanstead Playground 2
description: We have just completed our phase 1 crowd fund to raise £13,500 and we're now aiming for £25,000 to add a climbing frame to the equipment already secured.

name: Melting Pot @ London Sculpture Workshop
description: London Sculpture Workshop seeks to set up a community ceramics hub and foundry to upskill communities through material engagement and widen participation in creative learning across all demographics.

name: Hull Folk and Maritime Festival
description: The Hull Folk and Maritime Festival is a vibrant weekend which offers a performance platform for local and regional acts, and the opportunity for the community to discover and enjoy all things folk.

name: Roman Gardens, Castlefield
description: Welcome to the future, two thousand years ago. You're standing right in the heart of Roman Manchester, just outside the North Gate. But wait...

name: Peckham Means Business
description: The Peckham Enterprise Centre is a place where young ambitious people from disadvantaged backgrounds can access the space and support they need to turn their business ideas into reality.

name: The Berry Maze
description: Building a berry maze instead of a field of weeds for the community of South Bristol to enjoy. The design will be created by the children from the local school.

name: The Peckham Coal Line urban park
description: The Peckham Coal Line will be an elevated urban park built on disused railway coal sidings to form a natural, physical and social link between two high streets

name: Park and Slide
description: We want to temporarily transform Park Street in Bristol in to a giant water slide for the public to enjoy! Help us make this ambitious and fun idea become a reality!

name: St Albans Playground Appeal
description: The Friends of Victoria Playing Field (FVPF) are a group of local residents keen to turn the existing dilapidated playground into a fantastic new play facility at the heart of the community

name: Good Food Catford
description: I want to create a community-centered grocery store & deli focusing on local, seasonal foods and basic goods, breathing a new lease of life into our once vibrant shopping parades.

name: The Big Park Sleepover 2016
description: Explore a park at night! This is a FREE summer sleepover camping mini-festival for low income/local families in the heart of London's Myatt's Fields Park on Sunday 28th/Monday 29th August 2016.

name: A new natural building for Orchard Barn
description: Orchard Barn needs more covered teaching space. It's time to build a new vernacular style craft room from local trees + earth. Developing deep green traditional building skills as well as community.

name: From Musician to Nutrition
description: Help us put on a fantastic gig on 25th March at Rebellion, showcasing some of the best emerging Manc musical talent whilst helping us to raise funds in aid of Manchester Central Food bank.

name: Peckham Lido
description: The once loved Peckham Lido has been buried underground for almost 30 years. We now want to bring it back, better than ever, for the whole community to enjoy.

name: St Ann's Redevelopment Community Bid
description: StART is a Community Land Trust seeking to acquire and redevelop two-thirds of the St Ann’s Hospital site. We want a community-led housing development which meets the needs of people, not profit.

name: Save the Ancoats Dispensary
description: We have 100 days to save the derelict Grade II listed Ancoats Dispensary from demolition to transform it into a fantastic hub for the community and creative industries. We can’t save it without YOU!

name: Raise the Roof at Lordship Hub
description: Following our successful crowdfunding campaign in 2014, help us with round 2 to weather-proof our terrace so that we can increase our capacity and continue to serve as a hub for the local community.

name: Perivale wood Centre (Project 21)
description: Building a Straw Bale Education Centre in Perivale Wood to give children Londonwide the opportunity to understand and enjoy nature and The love of being outdoors.

name: Build a bouldering room at Minehead EYE!
description: We want to add a new and challenging bouldering room to our facilities, providing safe but adrenalin-inducing overhangs and complex shapes to develop skills and confidence.

name: Vulpes Vulpes New Space
description: Hello! We are Vulpes Vulpes - an artist-led group looking for help with the startup costs of our new not-for-profit project space in Bermondsey.

name: Glyncoch Community Centre
description: From bingo to Taekwondo: help us build a brand new multi-purpose community centre that creates an active hub for Glyncoch!

name: Creating Commons in New Cross
description: This is a project to collectively design, fund, build and maintain a new common resource – a public garden in New Cross with facilities to support local self-organised activities, events and projects.

name: Pinwheel Pavilion
description: The Pinwheel Pavilion is designed to engage the community and explore the potential energy that a single action triggers.

name: Global Garden, Global Kitchen
description: The Global Garden, Kitchen will transform unused space into a new community food garden and kitchen where local people can learn to grow and cook a mix of produce that reflects Tottenham's diversity.

name: Pengelicious
description: A real food festival for Penge SE20, for local residents and traders to share their recipes and dishes, cooked by local people and businesses using ingredients from local suppliers.

name: Croydon Saffron Central
description: A pop up Saffron Farm to share with all of Croydon. Bringing the Crocus Valley to every garden & belly in Town.

name: Middleport in Motion: the Steam Engine
description: Help bring the William Boulton Steam Engine at Middleport Pottery back to life!

name: Save South Dock Boatyard
description: This is a community effort to engage with the council in a meaningful way regarding the redevelopment of South Dock Marina Boatyard.

name: Bring the #AdpRiotTour to Macc!
description: Chaotic scenes in a 40ft shipping container! An irreverent, thought-provoking artwork by Jimmy Cauty (first seen at Banksy’s Dismaland) comes to Macc in November.

name: Freshwell Mobile!
description: Our pop-up stall displays healthy fruit & vegetables at the heart of communities & estates. We aim to improve health & well-being by giving access to affordable fresh produce to those needing it most.

name: Hackney Cup for Health
description: Help us bring this exciting 7-aside football tournament to Hackney, brought to you by your local community club Hackney Wick FC, for the enjoyment of all of Hackney!

name: Help Stitched Up Get Mobile
description: We are Stitched Up, a non-profit sewing cooperative who want to take our community workshops onto the road with a new custom built bike trailer!

name: Creating Katherine Buchan Meadow TYS2
description: At the heart of Old Hanwell conservation area with the historical Victorian church building as it's backdrop sits a well-used but unnoticed, neglected green. Our mission is to bring it back to life.

name: Transforming Copley Close - TYS2
description: Hanwell Big Local and Cultivate London aim to make Copley Estate a vibrant and safe place to be, while working with the community to provide training and work opportunities for local young people.

name: Uplift Salcombe Gardens Shops
description: The 6 shop fronts look very "tired" and unattractive to potential shoppers. The precinct is a poor gateway to the 500+ homes within 1/2 mile. A makeover will improve their trade and the street-scene

name: Hackney Playbus
description: Our Playbus has been coming to Millfields Park in Hackney for 8 yrs. In summer we welcomed over 70 children per session. Our funding ends in May. Please help us so we can be there in Spring 2013!

name: The Big Bad Tea Party
description: The event will be the largest community tea party hosted in aid of Contact the Elderly, the UK’s only national charity focused exclusively on combating loneliness amongst the older community.

name: Liven up the Leys
description: Liven up the Leys’ aim is to provide the children of Witney with modern play facilities within The Leys recreation area

name: HappyFeet@ Celebrate: Light up your Life
description: Happy Feet @ Celebrate: Thousands of people - all ages & cultures have been part of our community-led festival for 17 years. Help us raise £2411 to make our 18th Festival happen on June 27th!

name: Stockwell Urban Oasis
description: We want to create an inspiring and educational "forest garden" with a strong focus on adventure. A place where children from surrounding communities can learn and play together.

name: Merchant of Venice: Barking Town centre
description: Shakespeare on the street: Merchant of Venice told in a new way to a new audience with the landmarks of Barking Town Centre as the backdrop. Professional actors and local people performing together

name: Incredible Edible Bristol
description: We want to transform Bristol in to the UK's first Edible City. Help us make it happen!

name: Loop de Loop
description: We want to convert the old blue toilet block in central Frome into four micro-galleries and a local food kiosk PLUS repair a unique heritage glass block artwork containing industrial artifacts.

name: Support our annual, affordable panto!
description: Our alternative pantomime is a homegrown affair, with ticket prices kept low so families across Hull can celebrate Christmas. We need your help to keep the tradition alive for those most in need.

name: A shared space for stories in Tottenham.
description: We have a space from Haringey Council - a warehouse and yard seconds from Tottenham Hale. It will become a space for people to share stories; books, storytelling, music, performances and long chats.

name: Stanley's Christmas Extravaganza
description: Our vision is to empower our diverse community through a day-long festive celebration of community, togetherness and the magic of cinema.

name: UK's first Sustainable Department Store
description: Britain's First Sustainable Department Store for the Day brings 200 of Britain's most inventive, cutting edge and sustainable businesses to the heart of the high street.

name: Signing The Sheffield Antiques Quarter
description: The Sheffield Antiques Quarter is a vibrant part of Sheffield and a destination for the city. We want to really put our stamp on the Quarter so when you've arrived you will know you have arrived.

name: Abundance at Edible York
description: Abundance - picks surplus fruit growing in York's gardens and in the wild so that it is put to good use - gathered and distributed to local people, especially those who will benefit most..

name: Catford South Kids' Lantern Parade
description: Twilight. Music and children's voices float across the terraced streets. A procession of lights swings into view. Happy children's faces glow in the swaying lantern lights...

name: Venture Kids Carnival!
description: Help us take our children on the road for the very first time at this year’s Notting Hill Carnival!

name: Recipes for food and architecture
description: Build your own community restaurant! Donate £10 and help us print a how-to guide based on our experience of building and running a food-for-food exchange restaurant in London's Ridley Road Market.

name: Faster Broadband for Twyford
description: The project is to facilitate the implementation of fast fibre Broadband in Twyford.

name: Flaxmill Maltings Open Mic Marathon
description: We will be hosting an Our Big Gig music event at the Shrewsbury Flaxmill Maltings on Friday the 11th of July, bringing attention to the site and creating a celebration for local contributors!

name: Converting Water Tank to Art Space
description: Help us drain and convert a disused water tank near Lewisham Train Station/High Street into a multi-use art space and café! Our goal is to develop this into a creative space in the borough's heart.

name: UCLoo Festival 2013
description: Do you know your shit? UCLoo Festival is part of an international day of action, World Toilet Day, that will break the taboo around what we flush and draw attention to the global sanitation challenge.

name: Tritton Vale Pocket Garden
description: We will transform a neglected strip of land into a beautiful garden for the whole community to enjoy! Our core commitment is to promote: community, biodiversity, education, art & enjoyment of nature.

name: Water for Mitcham Community Orchard
description: The fruit trees, flowers and bushes in our orchard urgently need a water supply if they are to bear fruit and provide pleasure years to come. Please help raise money for a water pipe to the site.

name: Cambridge Road lamp posts
description: Ensuring Cambridge Road, B13, has good street lighting that minimises the dazzle in people's homes and gardens - and is sympathetic to the architecture of the road.

name: Colour in Romford
description: We want to make our community colourful! Colour in Romford is a campaign to bring street art to our town, brightening up our grey High Street and creating community spirit.

name: V22 Workspace Creche
description: Workspace with creche, set in a studio space in Dalston with deskspace and access to a community garden, the perfect solution for artists, freelancers and creative entrepreneurs who are also parents.

name: Brockley Max's Art In The Park
description: We need your help to take Brockley Max community arts festival into its 15th year

name: Regenerate Tottenham Community Centre
description: IVO centre has served the communities for the past 20years providing information care and support for people living with HIV/AIDS, running children activities support groups for the elderly and women

name: The Yard Theatre
description: Save The Yard from winter closure! In 2011 we built a theatre, bar & kitchen in a vacant warehouse in Hackney Wick. Now we need your help to insulate the building so that we can open all year round!

name: An Amy Johnson Parade
description: Help us host a flight themed parade to celebrate the life of Amy Johnson, with live music, performance and dance, bringing a carnival atmosphere to Hessle Rd area of Hull

name: Light up St Albans
description: We want to brighten up St Albans this Christmas with some fantastic new lights for our Christmas tree! By buying & installing some new lights we can all enjoy Christmas that little bit more this year.

name: Wrexham. Honouring our Veterans.
description: To thank our local veterans we'd like to make their wish come true and preserve their standards, or ceremonial flags. I weld yr wybodaeth hon yn Gymraeg ewch i www.spacehive.com/wrecsam

name: Heroes Wood
description: Our project will create a WW1 centenary woodland to commemorate the involvement of Mancunians in the First World War with the involvement of local schools and residents.

name: Heaton Park Community Orchard
description: We'll create a vibrant and productive community orchard with the help of local young people and the community. Oh and we'll help save bees too!

name: The Porty Light Box
description: Local phone box to be renovated and to become a light box to display local artwork and images.

name: Micklegate Run Soap Box Challenge
description: The Micklegate Run Soapbox Challenge is destined to be a daring but hilarious go-cart race across the cobbles of Micklegate – one of York’s best known streets.

name: TWIST POP-UP ON STATION RISE TULSE HILL
description: A monthly pop-up market event that puts a TWIST on the use of the road by Tulse Hill Station, creates a buzz for locals and provides a much-needed economic boost for the area and local residents.

name: Rigg Monument, York
description: This 1830 graveyard monument to six children from the Rigg family drowned in a boating accident on the River Ouse is broken, eroded, overgrown and unloved. We want to repair and restore it.

name: Stevenson Square Green Makeover
description: We want to transform Manchester’s Stevenson Square into a green urban oasis. New street trees, hanging baskets and a green roof will provide a green amenity for residents, businesses, and visitors.

name: Paxton Primary allotment
description: Engaging parents and volunteers from the community to support children at school with growing their own vegetables and selling it on at affordable prices.

name: Catford Film Festival
description: Catford Film intend to host an exciting free film festival over several days, screening a variety of film genres across multiple local venues including bars, restaurants and open spaces

name: The Islington Gro-Mobile
description: We want to buy a milk float and turn it into a mobile potting shed and nature classroom that will empower communities to transform unloved spaces into on-the-doorstep veg patches and wildlife havens.

name: Catford Arts Trail
description: A free Catford Arts Trail/open house event, to celebrate creativity in Catford, where local artists and makers can show their work in various homes and public spaces over a weekend or two in 2016.

name: We're Kick-Starting Chameleon Youth
description: Help us raise £3,000 and support the next generation of dance artists. Funds will Kick-Start Chameleon Youth, and present their premiere outdoor dance performance in Manchester City Centre.

name: Punch and Juicy Market Place
description: Help us expand our healthy juice academy and Root to Market programmes with a pop up market stall, helping us become self sufficient and teaching our young participants valuable entrepreneurial skills

name: Hanwell Winter Christmas Fair
description: Hanwell Winter Christmas Fair brings together local businesses, charitable organisations and residents in fun celebration to help promote our town and the wonderful people who live here!

name: Greenwich Outdoor Classroom
description: Greenwich Ecology Park Outdoor Classroom! A fabulous educational space to inspire children and adults about wildlife, conservation, the environment - connecting them with nature & the outdoors!

name: Blue Plaque for Lady Rhondda
description: Help us to fundraise for a public memorial for Lady Rhondda in her home town of Newport. We want as many people as possible to get involved & contribute to put on a lecture and put up a blue plaque.

name: Seeing the Wood for the Trees
description: The project is to share this gem of land with it's surrounding community in the form of a Forest School. Engaging attendees in this natural environment to learn and explore all it has to offer.

name: The Community Kitchen
description: A Community Kitchen at the Museum of Futures, to harness and celebrate the culinary creativity in the community, enabling emerging local businesses that want to make, bake and cater in the area.

name: The Imagination Lab
description: The Imagination Lab is a brand new cultural space in London. lt will be the capital’s most exciting place for children and their families to imagine, explore, investigate and create together.

name: Redstart Arts
description: An exciting and empowering opportunity for adults with learning disabilities to work with visual artists weekly towards a career in the arts, exhibiting at The Deptford Lounge and Horniman Museum 2016

name: Joan Littlewood Sculpture
description: Help us produce a sculpture based on the iconic photo of legendary theatre director Joan Littlewood sitting on rubble outside Theatre Royal, to go in nearly the same spot as where the photo was taken.

name: Green Trafalgar Road
description: East Greenwich Residents Association wants your help to green Trafalgar Road, the only route between Greenwich Park and the River that leads to the Blackwall Tunnel.

name: Party in the Park 2016
description: Back for 2016! Party in the Park, is a free festival providing music and entertainment for the New Cross and Deptford communities, showcasing a large number of brilliant and diverse performers.

name: Manchester Youth Market
description: We need your support to help young Mancunians become successful entrepreneurs. We want to set up a youth market and other trading opportunities where they can test their business ideas at low risk.

name: TYS2 Piggeries Orchard
description: We transform inaccessible and unmanaged public land by the Grand Union Canal into an urban wildlife and nature mosaic of wildflower meadows, wetland, and fruit for foraging, wildlife, and relaxation.

name: Our Kilburn - Digital Noticeboard
description: We want to install a digital noticeboard on Kilburn High Road to showcase Kilburn's unique offerings and vibrant community, connecting residents and visitors up with everything Kilburn has to offer!

name: Our Big Gig at The Green Cafe!
description: We want to host a music event for our community as part of the Our Big Gig weekend, to raise funds for our project. We will have several bands, headlined by D'Ukes ukele band.

name: Sunderland student garden project
description: We're students aged 16-25 with learning difficulties who have a mission to turn our college's courtyard into a space to learn about seasonable vegetables and healthy home cooking

name: Arts & Music Fun Day
description: An interactive music and arts fun day in Belmont Park that will help us raise money to work with local vulnerable people, including people with mental health issues and learning disabilities!

name: After the riots - Happiness in Tottenham
description: A year ago Tottenham became the epicentre of chaos that spread across the entire UK. This exhibition will look at why and present creative and imaginative solutions to bring Happiness to Tottenham.

name: LOVE Life Slide for Tottenham children
description: Somerford grove adventure playground are raising money to transport and rebuild this 15 meter slide - custom built for a Waitrose campaign - onto this tower. See pics for more info!

name: Bellingham in Harmony
description: Bringing together music and dance groups in Bellingham, with the aim of performing together at the Lewisham People's Day in 2016. New friendships and stronger community bonds will form along the way.

name: Mystical outdoor learning space!
description: A mystical and magical outdoor learning space for preschoolers in a deprived area of Manchester to encourage greater understanding of the world around them.

name: REmix: Moston Lane
description: REmix Moston Lane will bring the community together to celebrate local food, arts & crafts and music, at Simpson Memorial Hall on Saturday 11 April 2015.

name: Trees on the Green
description: Making Trees from recycled materials in public spaces. The Trees will be regularly decorated to celebrate local projects & international events, artwork supplied by children & members of the community

name: Grow an Entrepreneur for Tomorrow
description: Help us turn an empty shop into a buzzing hub for young entrepreneurs! We'll create space where imaginations can be unleashed and bright business ideas brought to life.

name: Ripon Christmas Lights
description: We want to bring the festive atmosphere to Ripon by adorning our iconic city centre with an artistic classical display of pure white illuminations.

name: The Renovation of Wanstead Playground 3
description: We are a group of local parents galvanising our community to replace our dilapidated and poorly designed playground into somewhere amazing to play.

name: Bow Storyspace
description: Bringing stories to life for children and families in East London

name: New Cross & Deptford Free Film Festival
description: NXDFFF 2017 will offer 30 free film events over 10 days, organised by and for local people. The festival is a great way to bring people of all ages together to watch films in community venues.

name: Tattenhoe Park BT community fibre
description: The residents of Tattenhoe Park, Milton Keynes need fibre! Help support that dream here.

name: Help Hanover play!
description: We'd like to build an exciting new playground for the school children, with an emphasis on fitness and fun. Over 60% of the funds have been raised - with your help we can cross the finishing line!

name: Dance in the Dark
description: Challenge your senses and Dance in the Dark! Join us for an exciting afternoon in the park with Music, Dance for Health, Sport for All and Adult Bouncy Castles! Fun for all the family.

name: StoneCrabs Young Directors Festival
description: Young Directors Festival is a platform for practical development of the next generation of theatre makers bringing an eclectic mix of contemporary short plays to Deptford and London-wide audiences

name: St Georges redevelopment alternative
description: The St Georges church in Tufnell Park is under threat of demolition to make way for a housing development. The local community want to present a redevelopment alternative to Save St George.

name: Light-up Stalybridge this Christmas
description: Stalybridge Town centre has enjoyed the spirit of Christmas for many years. Traditionally, the highlight of the build up to Christmas is when Santa visits and switches on the Christmas lights.

name: West Hampstead 2015
description: Hanging baskets, public art, tree lighting, cool benches, promo videos are some of the projects we are currently raising funds to undertake in 2015. With your help we can make West Hampstead great!

name: Our Big Gig at Acocks Green Carnival
description: A free Our Big Gig event at Acocks Green Recreational Ground on Saturday 4 July as part of the annual Carnival, bringing families & the local community together to enjoy live music performances.

name: UNDERGROUND SOUND mini FEST
description: A four hour festival at Exeter Quayside on Friday 11th July 4 - 8pm UNDERGROUND SOUND mini FEST part of Our Big Gig weekend happening across UK. Communities celebrating together through music.

name: Pepys Estate 50th Anniversary Festival
description: In July 2016 the Pepys Estate in Deptford will be 50 and we are organising a festival with Music, Film, Pictures, Games, Craft to celebrate our diversity and amazing heritage. Come and join us!

name: Make Mansfield YOUR hotspot!
description: Help us launch a new era for shopping in Mansfield with FREE Wi-Fi. Surf the net, keep in touch with friends, access instant shopping offers, check emails and more - from anywhere in your town!

name: Whitaker Park Picnic Area
description: We have access to a disused animal enclosure which we would like to build into a family picnic area.

name: Creating a heart for Culbokie village
description: We have until mid April (2015) to purchase land in the centre of Culbokie (at Glascairn) for community use.

name: Paradise Park Pavilion
description: We want to rebuild a covered stage in the children's center's garden as a playful space where children who come to stay and play sessions can eat, play, read and mess about in the fresh air.

name: 1200 Origami Cranes
description: Be part of the largest community arts project in RBKC:  1200 origami cranes, 600 hours, nearly half a kilometre of string, 1 community.

name: Sydenham Arts Summer Festival
description: Sydenham Arts' annual July Summer Festival - a multi-disciplinary celebration of the arts taking place over 10 days across Sydenham and Forest Hill. Theatre, Visual Arts, Music, Poetry and more!

name: Blossoming Rose: Rosehill Traders Market
description: The Blossoming Rose: re-establishing the once-popular traders market to bring vibrancy and prosperity back to Rosehill by spurring entrepreneurialism and providing low-cost start-up business space.

name: Amble Puffin Festival
description: Amble Puffin Festival celebrates the puffin! Held at the best time of year to see our puffins & their pufflings. Walks, talks, food & drink, crafts, music & eco activities including an eco caravan.

name: Improve Mobility with Tai Chi and Yoga
description: Help improve mobility for those in Lewisham with Parkinson's disease and Multiple Sclerosis through regular access to tailored Tai Chi and Yoga sessions. We need your help!

name: Portobello Pantomime 2016
description: This year is the 25th anniversary of the Portobello Panto, which will be The Snow Queen, directed by Anna Chancellor.

name: Community Kiln
description: We need a shed to house our kilns. The kilns will be for the community to hire and will be used for Art4Space community art projects and training courses.

name: The Brixton Bolt 2013
description: Who is the fastest man/ woman/ child in Brixton?

name: Mackem Mash Up
description: A day of great live music providing the opportunity for some of Sunderland's emerging acts to showcase their talent and for audiences to participate in a variety of music workshops!

name: Croydon Interfaith Bike Ride & Picnic
description: The bike ride is an inclusive cycling event which is open to all. It involves stops at various faith centres along the way and ends at Parkhill Recreation ground for a Big Lunch interfaith picnic.

name: Collyhurst Hall - The Dig
description: We are a group of avid amateur archaeologists based at MCA who are planning to excavate the remains of Collyhurst Hall, just north of the City Centre.

name: Lewisham HIV Empowerment Centre
description: We want to empower those living with HIV in Lewisham, through the creation of a centre where our organisation can offer training, conferences, counselling and other services

name: Litten Reserve Community Space TYS
description: Restore the classroom in the Litten Nature Reserve, safeguarding a unique community education space, enabling continued and improved access to outdoor learning and wildlife.

name: The Queen's Jubillegal Head
description: We want to make a replica of the Queen's head, strap it to a barge and float it down the Regents Canal, leading a spectacular free-for-all Jubillegal flotilla, 1 day before the real thing!

name: St Mellitus Open Space
description: Our TYS project aims to transform the currently inaccessible and under used church garden area so that the community of Hanwell can also use and enjoy this space.

name: Sleaford Teenage Market
description: Sleaford Town Team aims to raise funds to buy the rights to run the "Teenage Market" in Sleaford. This is a proven platform to promote young entrepreneurs & performers, & boosts town centre footfall.

name: Rochdale Feel Good Festival 2013
description: The Feel Good Festival 2013 is a FREE festival held in Rochdale Town Centre, returning for the sixth year running on Friday 30 & Saturday 31 August, attracing thousands of visitors every year.

name: Golborne Road Festival
description: A fun-filled, family orientated street party featuring live music, international food, arts and crafts, children’s entertainment and more

name: Rochdale Skills Festival
description: Employers need employees, young people need jobs. This event brings them together, informing and inspiring students and helping them find out what they need to do to get their dream job.

name: Flaxivity Open Mic Marathon
description: We will be hosting an Our Big Gig music event at the Shrewsbury Flaxmill Maltings on Saturday the 11th of July, bringing attention to the site and creating a celebration for local contributors!

name: Keep the REAP Community Centre alive
description: Help us keep the Reap Community Centre alive so we can continue delivering fun activities and essential support for all the community

name: Stories, Singalong & Christmas Party!
description: Christmas fun & creativity at 12 Lewisham Care Homes - with memories of the old days, singalongs, a show & party! Weekly singalongs run by experienced actor-musicians, ending with a community show.

name: Whitley Bay Christmas Lights
description: Whitley Bay Big Local, in partnership with local people, community groups and North Tyneside Council are planning to do something really special at Whitley Bay Station this Christmas.

name: The Heron
description: Renowned Street artist ATM to highlight endangered British birdlife with a large scale artwork placed in the urban environment.

name: A Case of History for Wythenshawe Hall
description: We want to showcase your/our history.

name: Making Wembley Wonderful
description: Help us turn disused, neglected, high-street spaces into attractive centres for civic, commercial, educational and empowering services that improve local life and the local economy!

name: Workshop fit-out and programme of events
description: This project is to fit out the workshop to a professional standard and fund a programme of events to encourage increased and sustained engagement by the local community.

name: Whalley Rangers 2015
description: We are asking for your help to get the Whalley Rangers' community gardening off to a great start.

name: Music & Celebration in Whitchurch
description: Centre NE are hosting Our Big Gig 2015 - a celebration of music and young people in Whitchurch over the last 45 years. A free event of music and workshops on Saturday 11th July from 3pm onwards.

name: Cardiff Community Cohesion Cup 2015
description: The CCCC'15 is a football tournament between BME communities within Cardiff. The objective is to build relationships trust, and improve communications with local authorities & the community itself.

name: The Butetown Mile is back!
description: The Butetown Mile is a 1-mile running event along Bute Street in Butetown, Cardiff.

name: stickyshoes
description: After a few years hiatus stickyshoes are back in Wakefield putting on all ages events, starting with a day arts festival at the grade II listed building 'The Orangery'.

name: Our Big Gig in the Arboretum 2016!
description: Our Big Gig in the Arboretum gives people of all ages the opportunity to organise a local music festival, local artists to showcase their talents & offers the city of Lincoln a free music festival.

name: Camrose Centre - Extra Day of Support
description: The Camrose Centre is a drop-in centre to help homeless and vulnerable people. We want to open the centre for an extra day so that those who are sleeping rough can come and get breakfast.

name: Withernsea Pirates Big Gig Warm Up
description: A full day of entertainment to bring together many different groups and organisations in the town to celebrate the popular and colourful image of Pirates in Music, Dance, Art, Theatre and Song.

name: Woodland oasis in the heart of industry
description: We need TYS to help us create a woodland oasis that will provide the lungs for our forgotten community, isolated and squashed by industry on every side. It will help us breath again.

name: Ripon Christmas Lights 2014
description: Following last years successful fundraising campaign for Christmas lights, we want to make the city even better this year by replacing the lights in Kirkgate, Westgate, Fishergate & Old Market Place.

name: LOVE New Brighton Parade
description: Love New Brighton Parade's a fantastic new event for the people of New Brighton and visitors to this famous seaside resort on the Wirral, Merseyside. This July little bit of Rio comes to New Brighton!

name: Our Big Gig in the Arboretum 2015!
description: Our Big Gig in the Arboretum gives people of all ages the opportunity to organise a local music festival, local artists to showcase their talents & offers the city of Lincoln a free music festival.

name: Sunbeam Tots Playgroup
description: The St. Laurence Sunbeam project make a difference as it brings together the adults and children of the diverse local community by provding a safe and affordable place to meet and play

name: Afghan Community Integration Project
description: We aim to promote integration and inclusion in UK society whilst preserving and celebrating cultural heritage. Our mission is to empower refugees, asylum seekers and migrants towards integration.

name: WoodgatePrimaryOurBigGig
description: Musicians from the 'On The Edge' Fusion Youth Orchestra teaching team will provide four hours of fun music making and live music performance for an audience of Woodgate Primary School pupils.

name: Drum Together Brum Street Party
description: A free afternoon street party where the local community can get involved. We'll have instrument making workshops, music sessions, and will finish with a performance by Drum Together Brum.

name: Palace Gates
description: The Palace Gates Project is a public art memorial to commemorate the former railway line which ran through our community.

name: Community Green House from Recycling
description: When temperatures are inhospitable, new seeds need a safe, warm space to sprout, or plants need protection from wildlife or wind, a greenhouse can be a literal lifesaver!

name: Big Community Clean Up @ Manor Park 12/3
description: The simple act of picking up litter as a group can act as a catalyst for huge change.We want everyone to show they Love Where They Live.

name: Our Space Your Place
description: Our Space Your Place will give students at the University of Worcester their first taste of retailing through a competition to win a six week space at a retail unit at CrownGate shopping centre

name: Wyre Forest Young Musicians Competition
description: Bewdley Youth Festival is holding a music competition on Saturday 12th July for all young people who live in the Wyre Forest district and are in full time education.

name: Lighting up the town of Tadcaster 2015
description: We have been asked by the Town Council to organise this year's Christmas Illuminations and make them the biggest and best Tadcaster has ever known!

name: Queen's Park HighStreet: The Harrow Road
description: The Queens Park Community Council wishes to trigger a positive transformation of our section of the Harrow Road - particularly between the Kilburn Lane/ Ladbroke Grove junction and Maida Hill Market.

name: Light Up Harlow Town Centre
description: Support Harlow Town Centre this Christmas and light it up! The Harlow Town Centre Partnership is asking shops, businesses and anyone else to donate to the town centre Christmas Lights Fund.

name: Live@thimblemill library our big gig
description: music festival and fun music workshops for all, Live local music, open mic,drumming and ukulele workshops, storytelling, kids art workshops and lots of fun for all to enjoy and to and participate

name: Our Big Gig Lights Camera Action
description: Our Big Gig Lights, Camera Action is a Our Big Gig event, which includes four creative arts workshops of dance, song-writing, poetry/spoken word, DJ-ing skills and a GRAND FINALE Open Mic night.

name: Fugglestock
description: Fugglestock is a day of music and entertainment, to raise funds for Rowcroft Hospice and celebrate the life of my old friend, musician, singer and entertainer, Charlie Fuggle. Come and join in !

name: Mint Street Music Festival 2015
description: A music festival in Mint Street Park, Southwark SE1. We aim to bring the community together to celebrate their local musical talents and get more people involved in music making and dance.

name: All Things Morris in Ilfracombe
description: A weekend event to celebrate 'All Things Morris' including dance, art, music, food and sport. Friday 10 (eve), all day Sat & Sun 11 & 12 July 2015

name: Rice Paper Tales
description: Rice Paper Tales presents a series of traditional Vietnamese folktales through interactive storytelling, live music and multi-sensory audience experience to children and families.

name: Sustainable Bridges Makerspace
description: Sustainable Bridges Makerspace will offer low carbon innovators affordable access to prototyping tools, supplemented by entrepreneurial learning sessions to transform ideas into viable businesses.

name: Get Up Stand Up - Dance Tour Launch
description: We believe in the power of music and dance to bring people together to be creative, express themselves and unite. This is the launch of the Get Up Stand Up Dance Tour Project.

name: Incredible Edible Rochdale
description: IER will transform unused and disused spaces in Rochdale town centre into beautiful food growing hotspots. Local communities, shops, schools and colleges will adopt a plot and become urban farmers.

name: Cage Cricket in SW1
description: The English invented cricket. Now a fast-paced urban version of the sport - Cage Cricket - is catching on and with your help SW1 will host the first Cage!

name: A Child's Dream
description: Immy age 15 is building a Sensory Garden for a young girl with Autism as a pilot for a Community Garden. It's a quiet haven full of different sights sounds and smells. Email ingrid.horgan@yahoo.co.uk

name: Follow The White Rabbit
description: Discover the real Alice in Wonderland (Alice Liddell) and the connection to Llandudno by following the White Rabbits and Rabbit's Footprints around the town.

name: Blake Gardens Summer Bandstand Lift-off!
description: Kicking off the Blake Garden Music Festival summer series with a bang! As well as Chard Concert Brass we want to add more exciting acts to the line up to enhance your sunny afternoon in the park.

name: Sound of the Suburbs: Our Big Gig 2015
description: Sound of the Suburbs is part of Bradford's fantastic annual Urban Festival. We'll be programming an utterly amazing day of the best UK and local urban music acts, street dance, visual art and more!!

name: New parks library cafe big gig
description: This is a free event taking place at New Parks Library on July 11th, from 11- 4pm. combining music workshops,world food & a Guinness book of records attempt! Everyone is welcome.Let's celebrate!

name: Our Big Gig at Page Park
description: Westerly Showband are presenting a day of free music at Page Park, Staple Hill in South Gloucestershire.

name: Adelante Advances Market
description: Springboard the vibrant Latin American cultural offer into East Street market, take Adelante Market/Plaza Latina up a level, positioning a weekly market, share training and entrepreneurial activity.

name: Carols on the Green Bellingham 2016
description: For the 13th year we are drawing local musical talent together for a memorable carol performance on Bellingham Green for the enjoyment of the whole community

name: Delivering Superfast Internet in Camden
description: We are seeking to raise a target of £4,780 to provide Regents Park Terrace, and parts of Oval Road of Gloucester Crescent with faster internet access.

name: P.A.R Project (ELSS)
description: We make learning robotics and science fun for children, but we need your help!

name: South London Art Map
description: Help support the next year of the South London Art Map including tours, printed map and SLAM Fridays late night opening of galleries and studios on the last Friday of every month.

name: Journey 21 U-Turn
description: Helping to change the negative stereotype surrounding young people through a variety of youth events held at the Riverside Centre in Deptford.

name: Acton Community Christmas Fair
description: A Christmas Fair that brings the people of Acton together, celebrates the diverse community, showcases the unique local talent and encourages local spend in the town centre in the run up to Christmas.

name: Shumba Community drum circle and party
description: A drum circle and party to raise funds for Kinkeling Garden in The Gambia. A chance for the Community to come together and have fun drumming and dancing whilst supporting a small Gambian project.

name: Ten Grand Arcade
description: Providing an accessible space for community groups to meet, and art gallery for student and local artists and a new business hub as well as working with retailers to enhance areas shopping experience.

name: Bowburn brass band celebration
description: Kippax Band will march Bowburn’s banners through village and into Durham on Gala Day – whole community invited to join in. Pittington Brass and DENNIS will engage audience in Eve of Gala Concert.

name: Our Big Gig On The Edge at Ryders Green
description: 'On The Edge' will bring a team of musicians to play a range of musical styles and make free music workshops available to children and their families in the local Sandwell community.

name: Uppingham Webcam
description: To create 24/7 online access to the town centre and to a series of major community events via a web cam mounted in the market place

name: FORVIL Community Health Project
description: The FORVIL Community Health Project aims to address the health inequalities in Lewisham raised by the local Vietnamese Community and acknowledged by the local NHS Clinical Commissioning Group.

name: Our Big Gig 'On The Edge' at Milebrook
description: Four hours of live music and music workshops at Milebrook Hall and the surrounding green space.

name: The Barford Festival - 2015
description: We are Celebrating 10 years of fantastic family fun and in doing so, supporting 10 causes close to our hearts.

name: Gig in the Pub
description: Gig in the Pub is a biannual event showcasing local young musical talent from across the Hope Valley. It is held at Bamford's community hub, the Anglers Rest, which is owned by the local community.

name: Making a Makerspace
description: We're a member-owned and run community workshop where people can pursue their hobbies and discover new technology. We aim to provide the space, tools and knowledge that people don't have at home.

name: Do Up Our Alley
description: To reclaim the alleyways to our High Street from the rubbish and poor maintenance. To make them safe and inviting so people use them. To promote the businesses located in them.

name: ReNewNewEltham
description: Partnership of community groups/local people/businesses to revitalise & regenerate New Eltham high street & improve community/business engagement & make New Eltham a sustainable shopping destination.

name: EnfieldThinks
description: Enfield Council, Birkbeck University and the Borough’s colleges – CONEL, Barnet & Southgate and Capel Manor - will turn an empty retail unit in Burleigh Way into EnfieldThinks, a pop-up university.

name: Opening Up Creative Hackney
description: Improving the connection between world leading artists, makers and creatives and Hackney's residents and visitors to its high street headquarters, 'the gateway to central Hackney'.

name: Burghead Tennis
description: A simple solution to the lack of facilities in the town.

name: Longacres : Keep It Green
description: Providing St.Albans with a greener, safer area for families, walkers and residents. Maintaining our green spaces with young trees for the future.

name: Music Extravaganza
description: On Saturday 12th July the Music school will be presenting a Summer Bash in the form of a Showcase, exhibiting our wide range of talents.

name: Bands In The Park
description: Swing, jazz, rap, hip hop or rock – whatever you play, sing or perform you could help Minehead find a new vibe this summer.

name: PCCOBG 2015
description: Phoenix Cultural Centre wants to create an Arts and Performance Project in Woking

name: Summer fun and sports extravaganza
description: An exciting community sports, fun and laughter day! We are a new church to the area and want to support the community and bring it together in the local park in August 2016.

name: Imagination to Play
description: Manor Park playground needs a new life with some enjoyable creativity for children to play, learn and interact. We thought tires for a tired playground and a mural on the wall is a way forward...

name: Turf-Fit!
description: Turf Projects hopes to transform an empty Workout shop in Croydon into an artist-run space, including gallery & affordable workspace; activated through a year-long programme of exhibitions & events

name: BANTER
description: We want to make our community laugh! BANTER is a monthly pop-up comedy club, located in a variety of secret locations throughout Romford that will truly bring laughter to the heart of our High Street.

name: ARThouse on the High Street
description: An innovative visual arts hub animating an empty shop on Twickenham high street and providing space for creative skills-sharing for the local community

name: The Barford Festival
description: Celebrating our 9th year, the 2014 festival will be held on Saturday July 12th and is an exciting and fun summer family festival with tons of entertainment for all.

name: Northgate Herb and Fruit Beds
description: Turn a derelict eyesore into a pleasant small garden, growing fruit bushes and herbs for all to use.

name: Harlesden Working Together
description: A neighbourhood plan and community hub in Harlesden to engage residents, business and faith groups in creating a spatial plan responding to local problems and combining aspirations around town centre

name: WeKnitWaterloo
description: We're taking knitting our high street & community together quite literally; bringing residents, businesses, community groups & schools together to create knitted signage celebrating our uniqueness.

name: Music In Mind
description: A chance to see the inspiring story "Alive inside" that captures the power of music with amazingly transformative results in the treatment of dementia and experience the magic that is music therapy

name: The Museum of Futures
description: A Museum of Futures in a vacant shop, to harness the energy of the community, encourage engagement with activity and to develop a vision for the kind of place people will celebrate with pride.

name: Roehampton Spills
description: To connect high street businesses and facilities pro-actively with outdoor events happening on their doorstep through curation of ‘creative spills’ onto the street and into the activity.

name: Tottenham Fast Food
description: Tottenham Fast Food is an ambitious restaurant initiative providing healthier alternatives to fast food, creating jobs, training opportunities, footfall and buzz in the centre of Tottenham.

name: Centrepoint Cafe
description: We want to open a weekend social enterprise café in Soho. The café will offer work experience to homeless young people aged 16-25, providing them with the skills and experience to find work.

name: Unique Sudbury
description: Engage with the local businesses and community to identify and promote a local identity for Sudbury.

name: LITERALLEY
description: LITERALLEY on Whitechapel High Street transforms an under-utilised alleyway into free public library and forum. An interactive bookshelf weaves through the alley connecting High Street neighbours.

name: Our Big Gig Summerfield Park
description: Ladywood Arts Forum presents a free Our Big Gig event at Summerfield Park on Saturday 12 July 2015, bringing families & the local community together to enjoy live music performances.

name: Wild Fox Party
description: Friend of Wild Fox want to put our playground on the map with a bang. Children and young people will have opportunity to learn an instrument and create songs. the whole event have a festival feel

name: South London Art Map 2016/17
description: Help support the next year of the South London Art Map including tours, printed map and SLAM Fridays late night opening of galleries and studios on the last Friday of every month.

name: Brockley Street Artists
description: Brockley Street Art Festival has already created more than 30 bright and colourful works of art on unloved parts of Brockley and the surrounding areas.

name: Fibre for Ditcham
description: Bringing fibre broadband to picturesque Ditcham in Hampshire, that will also enable superfast internet access to Ditcham Park School

name: Fast Fibre Broadband for Dunedin
description: Dunedin School needs faster broadband but there are no plans for our cabinet to be upgraded. We are interested in funding the upgrade as a community, which will also benefit the local school.

name: Superfast Broadband for Datchworth
description: We wish to push further with having high fibre broadband installed in our village. Bringing fibre broadband to Datchworth will also enable superfast internet access to Datchworth Pre-School

name: Spetisbury School
description: We need faster broadband but there are no plans for our cabinet to be upgraded. Bringing fibre broadband to Spetisbury will also enable superfast internet access to the local school.

name: Fibre for ‘The Yard’ North Bristol
description: The Yard needs faster broadband but there are no plans to upgrade. Bringing fibre to The Yard will also enable superfast internet access to Wildgoose Space, benefiting the children's education.

name: Superfast Internet for Bordesley
description: We want to get superfast broadband for the trading estate. Bringing fast fibre broadband to our ‘TA’ will also enable superfast internet access to the community nursery school.

name: Books, art and music for Forest Hill.
description: A fantastic space selling books & records to generate income for the community library scheme. A home for culture, art & the written word. Leaf & Groove will be a new hub for the community in SE23.

name: Old Kent Road studios
description: Help us transform 60 vacant garages on the Ledbury Estate into spaces for workshops, studios, cooking lessons and cultural activities where people can learn and socialise. Pledge your skills below!

name: KENSINGTON BOROUGH FC NEEDS YOUR HELP
description: We are reaching out to the Kensington & Chelsea crowd to help Kensington Borough FC to compete in our highest league to date and to hold a community football tournament for young people in the borough

name: Firs Farm Wetlands Festival 16 July 2016
description: We need your help to create this very special community event. Please donate as much as you can.Every bit helps. We are sure to have a great fun-filled community day with your help. Thank you

name: Hull Day of Traditional Dance
description: Hull city centre will welcome more than 40 teams of traditional folk dancers on September 23, 2017, for a dancing extravaganza.

name: Faster broadband for Wellow
description: This project will improve broadband speeds for about 90 properties as a result of the installation of a new telephone Cabinet by BT in Wellow.

name: Build, Book n Bake
description: Build, book, ‘n bake To test a new, highly efficient, portable community clay oven. Our design will be portable and benefit from a new rocket stove burn chamber.

name: Transforming Green Grosvenor Park
description: The Friends of Green Grosvenor Park in Salford, would like to further develop the park space as a destination for local people to enjoy with their families and be a place to relax and socialise.

name: Guildford Free Film Festival
description: GFordFFF 2017 will offer free film events, organised by and for local people. The festival is a great way to bring people of all ages together to watch films in interesting and unusual venues.

name: Lewisham Disability Fun Palace
description: We want to celebrate the creative energy of our clients by making a Fun Palace from our office in Bellingham in October 2016.

name: Discovering Our Histories -
description: 25 older people from a range of backgrounds will share their lives - including a unique flash-mob

name: Ping Pong in the Park
description: We want to install two outdoor table tennis tables in Burnham Park

name: North Mymms Defibrillator
description: We would like to install a Public Access Defibrillator outside the Memorial Hall, as this is a focal point in the village and it would be available to all residents.

name: EMERA Street Life
description: We want to re-instate disused pathways in order to bring our community together by providing a peaceful and calming space for them to be able to enjoy a safe and relaxing location to meet

name: Longhill - Don't Miss the Boat!
description: Did you know that all the streets on Longhill are named after rivers? We want to celebrate this with community events in the City of Culture Year for Hull and make sure Longhill doesn't miss the boat!

name: SOUNDCAMP at Stave Hill Ecological Park
description: On International Dawn Chorus Day over 6-7 May 2017, we share the live sounds of daybreak at soundcamps around the world in a 24 hour radio broadcast that loops the earth at sunrise.

name: Marden Codgers Planters
description: Last year we inherited planters will terrible soil condition but managed considerable plantings of shrubs and wildflowers. The end result changed a bombsite into a beautiful display.

name: Reimagining JORVIK-The Middleton Cross
description: We are reimagining the JORVIK Viking Centre after the recent flooding; bringing together our own artefacts with iconic Viking objects from across Britain including a replica of the Middleton Cross.

name: Hullabaloo Soapbox Challenge
description: The Hullabaloo Soapbox Challenge is undoubtedly here to bring enjoyment to Sandown Bay. A go-cart race along the bay with some adventurous and creative members of the public with their creative carts.

name: Coffee Feeds Flowers
description: This project will use old coffee grounds from the many local cafes to feed flowers on our new local community garden.

name: Community Garden and wildlife corner
description: to create a community garden to allow us to supply fresh fruit and vegetables to those that are in need to hold coffee and friendship mornings for the elderly community in a bid to tackle isolation

name: Connexions Community Centre
description: To improve our facility

name: The Rooker Project
description: Re birth of Bilston United FC. We need to raise funds for new security fencing as when the old Club folded over 10 years ago all the fencing was stolen leaving just an open field.

name: Spark York
description: Spark:York is a totally unique project for York; transforming a derelict city centre site into a perfect space to meet friends, eat, drink and socialise in a communal space in the heart of the city.

name: TYS2 garden 4 everyone
description: A garden that all local residents can enjoy including a community flower garden, a dog-exercising area, a small safe play garden for children, all softened by refreshed planting with new benches.

name: Holcombe & Hockworthy Fast Broadband
description: A not-for-profit community group aiming to bring super-fast fibre broadband to our villages

name: Calisthenics Bar Park & Allotment
description: Installing a Calisthenics Bar Park/Allotment on our estate to promote healthy mind & body. Focusing on our youth, giving them something positive, empowers & encourages healthy lifestyle changes.

name: The Lewisham Project
description: Connecting and celebrating the people of Lewisham through the usherettes and amazing community events.
